title: Leviticus Chapter 15 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Leviticus chapter 15 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Leviticus Chapter 15 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Leviticus Chapter 15.

questions.question: According to Leviticus 15:2, what makes a man unclean?
options: Having a running issue out of his flesh
questions.correctAnswer: Having a running issue out of his flesh
questions.explanation: Leviticus 15:2 states that when any man has a running issue out of his flesh, he is unclean because of his issue.

questions.question: What must a person do if they touch the bed of someone with an issue, according to Leviticus 15:5?
options: Wash clothes and bathe, remaining unclean until evening
Flee the camp for seven days
questions.correctAnswer: Wash clothes and bathe, remaining unclean until evening
questions.explanation: Leviticus 15:5 commands that anyone who touches the bed of a man with an issue must wash his clothes and bathe, and be unclean until the evening.

questions.question: What will happen to an earthen vessel that touches a man with an issue, according to Leviticus 15:12?
options: It shall be rinsed in water
It shall be set aside for seven days
It shall be offered as a sacrifice
questions.correctAnswer: It shall be broken
questions.explanation: Leviticus 15:12 specifies that any earthen vessel touched by a man with an issue shall be broken.

questions.question: How many days must a man with an issue wait after being cleansed before offering the sacrifices described in Leviticus 15:13-15?
questions.correctAnswer: Seven days
questions.explanation: Leviticus 15:13 says that after being cleansed, the man shall number seven days for his cleansing before proceeding to offer sacrifices on the eighth day.

questions.question: What animals must the cleansed man bring to the priest on the eighth day, according to Leviticus 15:14?
options: Two turtledoves or two young pigeons
questions.correctAnswer: Two turtledoves or two young pigeons
questions.explanation: Leviticus 15:14 instructs the man to bring two turtledoves or two young pigeons to the priest on the eighth day.

questions.question: True or False: Leviticus 15:16 states that if any man's seed goes out from him, he must wash all his flesh and be unclean until evening.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Leviticus 15:16 confirms that if a man's seed goes out from him, he must wash all his flesh and remain unclean until the evening.

questions.question: According to Leviticus 15:18, who must bathe themselves when a man lies with a woman and seed is involved?
options: Both the man and the woman
questions.correctAnswer: Both the man and the woman
questions.explanation: Leviticus 15:18 states that both the man and the woman must bathe themselves in water and be unclean until the evening.

questions.question: What must happen to anyone who touches a woman during her menstrual issue, according to Leviticus 15:19?
options: He shall be unclean until the evening
He shall be put outside the camp
He shall offer a sin offering
He shall fast for seven days
questions.correctAnswer: He shall be unclean until the evening
questions.explanation: Leviticus 15:19 indicates that whoever touches a woman during her menstrual issue shall be unclean until the evening.

questions.question: What is unclean according to Leviticus 15:20 besides the woman with the issue?
options: Everything she lies upon and everything she sits upon
Only the ground she walks on
questions.correctAnswer: Everything she lies upon and everything she sits upon
questions.explanation: Leviticus 15:20 states that every thing she lies upon and every thing she sits upon shall be unclean.

questions.question: According to Leviticus 15:24, what happens if a man lies with a woman while her flowers are upon him?
options: He shall be unclean seven days and the bed shall be unclean
He must offer a burnt offering immediately
He must be separated for three days
questions.correctAnswer: He shall be unclean seven days and the bed shall be unclean
questions.explanation: Leviticus 15:24 says that if a man lies with a woman and her flowers are upon him, he shall be unclean seven days and the bed where he lies shall be unclean.

questions.question: True or False: Leviticus 15:25 says that if a woman’s issue continues beyond her separation time, she shall be unclean all the days of the issue.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Leviticus 15:25 states that if a woman’s issue continues beyond her separation time, all the days of the issue she shall be unclean.

questions.question: What must whosoever touch the things a woman with an issue has sat upon do, according to Leviticus 15:27?
options: Wash clothes, bathe in water, and be unclean until evening
Offer a sacrifice to the priest
questions.correctAnswer: Wash clothes, bathe in water, and be unclean until evening
questions.explanation: Leviticus 15:27 explains that anyone who touches such things must wash their clothes, bathe in water, and be unclean until the evening.

questions.question: On what day does the woman who has been cleansed bring two turtles or young pigeons to the priest, according to Leviticus 15:29?
questions.correctAnswer: The eighth day
questions.explanation: Leviticus 15:29 states that on the eighth day after cleansing, the woman shall bring two turtles or two young pigeons to the priest.

questions.question: True or False: Leviticus 15:31 explains that these laws are to keep the children of Israel from dying in their uncleanness.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Leviticus 15:31 clearly states that the purpose of separating the children of Israel from uncleanness is so they do not die in their uncleanness.

questions.question: Complete the verse from Leviticus 15:4: 'Every bed, whereon he lieth that hath the issue, is _______: and every thing, whereon he sitteth, shall be ________.'
questions.correctAnswer: unclean, unclean
questions.explanation: Leviticus 15:4 states that every bed where he lies is unclean, and everything he sits on shall be unclean.

medium.title: Leviticus Chapter 15 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Leviticus Chapter 15 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A believer is struggling with feelings of uncleanness due to a physical condition. Based on Leviticus 15, what biblical truth can you share about God's instructions regarding uncleanness?
options: God provides specific guidelines for cleansing and restoration after uncleanness.
Uncleanness is permanent and cannot be removed.
Uncleanness means God has rejected the person.
There is no concern for uncleanness in daily life.
questions.correctAnswer: God provides specific guidelines for cleansing and restoration after uncleanness.
questions.explanation: Leviticus 15:13-15 and 28-30 show that after a period of cleansing and offerings, a person is restored to cleanliness, teaching us that God provides a way for restoration and purity.

questions.question: How does Leviticus 15 teach us about the importance of personal discipline and obedience in spiritual life?
options: By requiring washing of clothes and bathing until evening after contact with uncleanness.
By allowing people to ignore uncleanness if they feel clean.
By instructing to avoid all social contact forever.
By focusing only on internal faith without external actions.
questions.correctAnswer: By requiring washing of clothes and bathing until evening after contact with uncleanness.
questions.explanation: Verses 5-7 emphasize obedience through ritual washing and waiting until evening, highlighting discipline in following God's commands for holiness.

questions.question: A husband and wife want to honor God in their marriage according to Leviticus 15. What biblical principle can they learn about purity and mutual responsibility?
options: Both must bathe themselves after sexual relations as a sign of purity.
Only the man is responsible for cleansing after intimacy.
No physical cleansing is necessary in marriage.
They should avoid intimacy to remain pure.
questions.correctAnswer: Both must bathe themselves after sexual relations as a sign of purity.
questions.explanation: Leviticus 15:18 teaches that both the man and the woman must bathe after sexual relations, showing mutual responsibility for purity in marriage.

questions.question: If a believer touches something or someone unclean according to Leviticus 15, what is the appropriate response to maintain holiness?
options: Wash clothes and bathe in water, remaining unclean until evening.
Ignore it and continue as usual.
Offer a sacrifice immediately without washing.
questions.correctAnswer: Wash clothes and bathe in water, remaining unclean until evening.
questions.explanation: Verses 5-11 and 27 specify washing and bathing until evening to restore cleanliness after contact with uncleanness, teaching practical steps to maintain holiness.

questions.question: How does Leviticus 15 encourage believers to handle situations of uncleanness in their community to preserve holiness?
options: By separating the unclean until they follow cleansing procedures.
By ignoring uncleanness to avoid division.
By publicly shaming the unclean person.
By refusing to associate with anyone.
questions.correctAnswer: By separating the unclean until they follow cleansing procedures.
questions.explanation: Leviticus 15:19-31 describes separation and cleansing rituals to prevent defiling the tabernacle, emphasizing community holiness and order.

questions.question: What practical lesson about integrity and honesty in daily life can be learned from the detailed instructions about uncleanness in Leviticus 15?
options: God values transparency and obedience in all aspects, even physical conditions.
Physical conditions are irrelevant to spiritual integrity.
Only spiritual rituals matter, not physical actions.
Integrity is optional in daily living.
questions.correctAnswer: God values transparency and obedience in all aspects, even physical conditions.
questions.explanation: The chapter’s detailed laws (verses 2-33) show God’s concern for every detail, teaching believers to be honest and obedient in all areas of life.

questions.question: True or False: Leviticus 15 teaches that touching the flesh of a person with an issue makes one unclean until evening if hands are not washed.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Leviticus 15:11 states that touching a person with an issue without rinsing hands causes uncleanness until evening.

questions.question: True or False: According to Leviticus 15, the uncleanness caused by a bodily emission lasts indefinitely until a priest declares the person clean.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Uncleanness lasts until evening after washing, and then after a cleansing period and offerings, one is restored (Leviticus 15:13-15, 28-30).

questions.question: A believer wants to understand how to show humility and contentment with God's instructions about bodily uncleanness. Which statement best fits Leviticus 15's teaching?
options: Accept God's commands patiently and trust His wisdom in all situations.
Question and ignore God's detailed laws.
Feel ashamed and avoid fellowship permanently.
Seek to change the laws to fit personal desires.
questions.correctAnswer: Accept God's commands patiently and trust His wisdom in all situations.
questions.explanation: The chapter shows the importance of obedience and trust in God's holy standards, encouraging humility and contentment in following His ways (Leviticus 15:1-4, 31).

questions.question: How does Leviticus 15 instruct believers to demonstrate love for their neighbors in community life?
options: By following cleansing laws to prevent spread of uncleanness.
By ignoring uncleanness to avoid offending neighbors.
By isolating unclean people indefinitely without support.
By not discussing uncleanness issues at all.
questions.correctAnswer: By following cleansing laws to prevent spread of uncleanness.
questions.explanation: The laws about washing and separation (Leviticus 15:5-10, 19-27) protect the community’s holiness and health, demonstrating care and love for others.

questions.question: In the context of trials such as uncleanness, what perseverance lesson does Leviticus 15 offer to believers?
options: Endure the period of separation and cleansing trusting in God's restoration.
Give up hope of being clean again.
Ignore God's instructions to avoid hardship.
questions.correctAnswer: Endure the period of separation and cleansing trusting in God's restoration.
questions.explanation: Verses 13-15 and 28-30 show a process of cleansing that requires patience and faith, teaching perseverance through trials with trust in God.

questions.question: When a person is cleansed from an issue, what does Leviticus 15 say about the process to be restored to fellowship?
options: They must count seven days, wash clothes, bathe in running water, and offer sacrifices.
They are immediately clean without any steps.
They only need to confess verbally.
They must wait thirty days without any action.
questions.correctAnswer: They must count seven days, wash clothes, bathe in running water, and offer sacrifices.
questions.explanation: Leviticus 15:13-15 and 28-30 specify the cleansing period and offerings for atonement to restore fellowship with God and community.

questions.question: A believer is concerned about maintaining holiness in everyday tasks. What practical advice does Leviticus 15 provide regarding objects that come into contact with uncleanness?
options: Earthen vessels should be broken; wooden vessels rinsed; clothes washed.
Objects remain clean regardless of contact.
Only people need cleansing, not objects.
Objects should be ignored and reused.
questions.correctAnswer: Earthen vessels should be broken; wooden vessels rinsed; clothes washed.
questions.explanation: Leviticus 15:10-12 instructs how to treat objects touched by uncleanness, teaching practical stewardship and holiness in daily life.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Leviticus 15 teaches that if a woman has an issue of blood, she shall be put apart for _____ days.
questions.correctAnswer: seven
questions.explanation: Leviticus 15:19 clearly states that a woman with an issue of blood is set apart for seven days, emphasizing obedience to God's holiness standards.

questions.question: How does Leviticus 15 illustrate the value of forgiveness and reconciliation through its instructions?
options: By providing a clear path to cleansing and atonement after uncleanness.
By condemning those who become unclean permanently.
By ignoring uncleanness and pretending it does not exist.
By excluding unclean people from the community forever.
questions.correctAnswer: By providing a clear path to cleansing and atonement after uncleanness.
questions.explanation: The cleansing rituals and offerings (Leviticus 15:13-15, 28-30) show God's provision for forgiveness and restoration, teaching reconciliation.

questions.question: According to Leviticus 15, what spiritual discipline is demonstrated by carefully following God's laws about uncleanness?
options: Faith expressed through obedience and reverence for God's holiness.
Faith only in thoughts, ignoring actions.
Faith that disregards God's laws as outdated.
Faith that depends on human traditions instead of scripture.
questions.correctAnswer: Faith expressed through obedience and reverence for God's holiness.
questions.explanation: The entire chapter emphasizes following God's detailed laws as an expression of faith, reverence, and discipline (Leviticus 15:1-4, 31).

hard.title: Leviticus Chapter 15 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Leviticus Chapter 15.

questions.question: In Leviticus 15, what is the prescribed duration a man must remain unclean after his seed of copulation goes out from him?
options: Until he offers a sin offering
questions.correctAnswer: Until the even
questions.explanation: Leviticus 15:16 states that a man whose seed goes out must wash all his flesh and be unclean until the even, indicating the uncleanness lasts until evening.

questions.question: What must happen to an earthen vessel that a person with a running issue touches according to Leviticus 15?
options: It must be rinsed in water
questions.correctAnswer: It must be broken
questions.explanation: According to Leviticus 15:12, the vessel of earth that is touched by a person with an issue must be broken, reflecting the impurity's severity and cultural context of contamination.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: According to Leviticus 15, after a man with an issue is cleansed, he must number to himself ______ days for his cleansing.
questions.correctAnswer: Seven
questions.explanation: Leviticus 15:13 instructs that a man cleansed from his issue must count seven days for his cleansing, which is a ritual purification period.

questions.question: What offerings must be brought on the eighth day after cleansing from an issue, as described in Leviticus 15?
options: Two turtledoves or two young pigeons
questions.correctAnswer: Two turtledoves or two young pigeons
questions.explanation: Leviticus 15:14 prescribes bringing two turtledoves or two young pigeons to the priest on the eighth day as part of the cleansing ritual.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT required for someone who sits on anything where a man with a running issue has sat, according to Leviticus 15?
questions.correctAnswer: Offer a burnt offering
questions.explanation: Leviticus 15:6 states the person must wash clothes, bathe, and remain unclean until evening but does not require an offering for sitting on such an object.

questions.question: True or False: According to Leviticus 15, if a man with an issue spits on a clean person, that person becomes unclean until the evening.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Leviticus 15:8 explicitly states that if a man with an issue spits on a clean person, the latter becomes unclean until evening after washing clothes and bathing.

questions.question: What is the significance of the term 'unclean until the even' repeated in Leviticus 15 concerning ritual purity?
options: It marks the end of a day and a period of waiting
It indicates a permanent state of uncleanness
It refers to the Sabbath day only
It means uncleanness until the next morning
questions.correctAnswer: It marks the end of a day and a period of waiting
questions.explanation: The phrase 'unclean until the even' in Leviticus 15 (e.g., verses 5, 6, 7) reflects the Jewish concept of a day ending at evening, marking the duration of ritual impurity until sunset purification.

questions.question: According to Leviticus 15, how does the uncleanness of a woman's menstrual issue compare with that of a man’s running issue in terms of duration and purification?
options: Both require seven days of separation and a cleansing ritual
Only the man must offer sacrifices for purification
The man’s uncleanness requires a longer purification period
questions.correctAnswer: Both require seven days of separation and a cleansing ritual
questions.explanation: Leviticus 15:19-30 shows parallels between male and female issues, both requiring seven days of separation and a ritual cleansing involving offerings on the eighth day.

questions.question: What does the requirement that 'every vessel of wood shall be rinsed in water' (Leviticus 15:12) suggest about the cultural understanding of purity in ancient Israel?
options: Porous materials could be purified by rinsing
All vessels must be destroyed upon contamination
Only metal vessels are considered clean
questions.correctAnswer: Porous materials could be purified by rinsing
questions.explanation: Leviticus 15:12 differentiates between earthenware (broken) and wooden vessels (rinsed), indicating a nuanced purity law considering material porosity and contamination.

questions.question: In the context of Leviticus 15, what is the theological purpose of separating the children of Israel from their uncleanness?
options: So they do not die in their uncleanness
questions.correctAnswer: So they do not die in their uncleanness
questions.explanation: Leviticus 15:31 states that separation from uncleanness is to prevent death due to defiling the tabernacle, highlighting holiness and life preservation themes.

questions.question: Which New Testament passage most directly alludes to the purification rituals described in Leviticus 15?
options: Hebrews 9:13-14, discussing purification with blood and water
Acts 2:1-4, the coming of the Holy Spirit
questions.correctAnswer: Hebrews 9:13-14, discussing purification with blood and water
questions.explanation: Hebrews 9:13-14 refers to purification rites involving blood and water, paralleling Leviticus 15's ritual cleansing and foreshadowing Christ’s atoning sacrifice.

questions.question: What literary device is predominantly used in Leviticus 15 to structure the laws of uncleanness concerning males and females?
options: Chiasm, with parallel laws about males and females
Parable, telling a story about cleanliness
questions.correctAnswer: Chiasm, with parallel laws about males and females
questions.explanation: Leviticus 15 employs chiasm by structuring uncleanness laws in parallel sections about males (vv. 2-15) and females (vv. 19-30), illustrating symmetry in ritual purity.

questions.question: From a historical-cultural perspective, what does the detailed regulation of bodily emissions in Leviticus 15 reflect about ancient Near Eastern purity concepts?
options: A concern for maintaining communal holiness and tabernacle sanctity
An early form of medical hygiene
A legal code for social punishment
questions.correctAnswer: A concern for maintaining communal holiness and tabernacle sanctity
questions.explanation: Leviticus 15’s detailed purity laws reflect Israel’s cultural priority on holiness and maintaining the sanctity of the tabernacle, common in ancient Near Eastern religious systems.

questions.question: According to Leviticus 15, what is the consequence for someone who lies with a woman during her menstrual issue?
options: He shall be unclean seven days and the bed shall be unclean
He must offer a sin offering immediately
questions.correctAnswer: He shall be unclean seven days and the bed shall be unclean
questions.explanation: Leviticus 15:24 describes that a man who lies with a woman during her menstrual issue is unclean for seven days and the bed is also unclean, emphasizing ritual purity laws.

questions.question: True or False: Leviticus 15 requires a man with an issue to wash only his clothes and not bathe his flesh to become clean.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Leviticus 15:16 commands washing all his flesh in water, not just clothes, indicating the importance of full bodily cleansing for purity.

theological.title: Leviticus Chapter 15 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Leviticus Chapter 15 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to Leviticus 15, what is the spiritual status of a man who has a running issue from his flesh?
questions.correctAnswer: He is unclean
questions.explanation: Leviticus 15:2 clearly states that any man with a running issue out of his flesh is unclean. This reflects God's holiness standards and the need for purity (See also Leviticus 11:44, 1 Corinthians 6:19-20, Hebrews 12:14, and Psalm 24:3-4).

questions.question: What must a person do after touching the bed of someone who has a running issue?
options: Wash clothes and bathe, unclean until evening
questions.correctAnswer: Wash clothes and bathe, unclean until evening
questions.explanation: Leviticus 15:5 commands washing clothes and bathing, and being unclean until evening after touching the bed of a person with an issue. This ritual cleansing underscores the holiness and purity required before approaching God (cf. Exodus 30:19-21, Numbers 19:11-22, Hebrews 10:22, and 2 Corinthians 7:1).

questions.question: If a man’s seed of copulation goes out from him, what is required according to Leviticus 15?
options: Wash all his flesh and be unclean until evening
questions.correctAnswer: Wash all his flesh and be unclean until evening
questions.explanation: Leviticus 15:16 instructs that a man must wash all his flesh and remain unclean until evening if his seed goes out. This illustrates God's concern with bodily purity reflecting spiritual truths (cf. Genesis 38:9-10, Ezekiel 36:25, John 13:10, and Hebrews 9:13-14).

questions.question: What must a woman do if she has an issue of blood in her flesh?
options: Be set apart for seven days
questions.correctAnswer: Be set apart for seven days
questions.explanation: Leviticus 15:19 states a woman with an issue of blood is to be set apart for seven days. This separation highlights the holiness of God and the need for ceremonial cleanliness (cf. Leviticus 12:2-5, Numbers 19:11-12, Luke 2:22-24, and Hebrews 9:10).

questions.question: How many days must a man who had an issue wait after being cleansed before offering turtledoves or young pigeons?
questions.correctAnswer: Seven days
questions.explanation: Leviticus 15:13-14 requires seven days of cleansing before offering turtledoves or pigeons on the eighth day. This ritual speaks to the process of restoration and atonement, pointing toward Christ's perfect purification (cf. Leviticus 12:6-8, Numbers 6:13-14, Hebrews 9:11-14, and 1 John 1:7).

questions.question: What offerings does the priest make for the man or woman after cleansing from the issue, according to Leviticus 15?
options: One sin offering and one burnt offering
questions.correctAnswer: One sin offering and one burnt offering
questions.explanation: Leviticus 15:15 and 15:30 explain the priest offers one sin offering and one burnt offering for atonement after cleansing. This foreshadows Christ’s atoning sacrifice (cf. Leviticus 4:27-31, Hebrews 9:22, Romans 3:25, and 1 John 2:2).

questions.question: What happens to an earthen vessel touched by a person with an issue?
options: It shall be purified by fire
It is to be washed and reused
questions.correctAnswer: It shall be broken
questions.explanation: Leviticus 15:12 states the earthen vessel touched by a person with an issue must be broken. This shows the severity of uncleanness and the holiness of God's dwelling (cf. 2 Kings 4:38-41, Jeremiah 19:10, Hebrews 9:13, and Isaiah 30:14).

questions.question: According to Leviticus 15, what is the status of anyone who lies with a woman during her menstrual separation?
options: He shall be unclean seven days
He must offer a grain offering
questions.correctAnswer: He shall be unclean seven days
questions.explanation: Leviticus 15:24 explains that a man lying with a woman during her separation is unclean for seven days, highlighting God's standard for sexual purity and holiness (cf. Leviticus 18:19, Ezekiel 18:6, 1 Corinthians 6:18-20, and Hebrews 13:4).

questions.question: What must a person who touches a man with an issue do, if he has not rinsed his hands in water?
options: Wash clothes and bathe, unclean until evening
questions.correctAnswer: Wash clothes and bathe, unclean until evening
questions.explanation: Leviticus 15:11 commands washing clothes and bathing until evening after touching a man with an issue without rinsing hands. This ritual cleansing symbolizes separation from sin and the necessity for holiness (cf. Exodus 30:18-21, John 13:10, Hebrews 10:22, and Psalm 51:7).

questions.question: Fill in the blank: When a woman is cleansed of her issue, she shall number to herself _____ days, and after that she shall be clean.
questions.correctAnswer: seven
questions.explanation: Leviticus 15:28 states a woman counts seven days after being cleansed before she is clean, emphasizing ritual purity and restoration (cf. Leviticus 12:2, Numbers 19:11-12, Ezekiel 36:25, and Hebrews 9:10).

questions.question: What is the consequence for touching anything that a man with an issue sat or lay upon?
options: The person becomes unclean until evening
The person must offer a sin offering
questions.correctAnswer: The person becomes unclean until evening
questions.explanation: Leviticus 15:6 and 15:22 explain that touching anything where a man or woman with an issue sat or lay causes uncleanness until evening, symbolizing the need for separation from impurity (cf. Numbers 19:11, Mark 7:15, 2 Timothy 2:21, and Psalm 51:10).

questions.question: Which of the following best describes the purpose of the laws concerning uncleanness in Leviticus 15?
options: To separate the children of Israel from their uncleanness
questions.correctAnswer: To separate the children of Israel from their uncleanness
questions.explanation: Leviticus 15:31 states the purpose of these laws is to separate Israel from uncleanness so they do not die in defilement. This reveals God's holiness and desire for His people to be sanctified (cf. Leviticus 20:7-8, 1 Peter 1:15-16, 2 Corinthians 6:17, and Revelation 21:27).

questions.question: According to Leviticus 15, what must happen to every wooden vessel touched by a man with an issue?
options: It shall be rinsed in water
questions.correctAnswer: It shall be rinsed in water
questions.explanation: Leviticus 15:12 prescribes that every wooden vessel touched by a man with an issue must be rinsed in water, underscoring the importance of purification (cf. Numbers 19:17, John 13:10, Hebrews 9:10, and Ezekiel 36:25).

questions.question: What is required of both the man and the woman after sexual intercourse according to Leviticus 15?
options: Both shall bathe and be unclean until evening
questions.correctAnswer: Both shall bathe and be unclean until evening
questions.explanation: Leviticus 15:18 instructs that both man and woman shall bathe and be unclean until evening after sexual intercourse, emphasizing God's concern for ceremonial purity (cf. Genesis 2:24, 1 Corinthians 7:3-5, Hebrews 13:4, and Ephesians 5:31-32).

questions.question: What does the ritual of cleansing and offering sacrifices for uncleanness in Leviticus 15 symbolize in Christian theology?
options: The need for atonement and sanctification through Christ
The finality of the Old Covenant only
A ritual with no spiritual significance
questions.correctAnswer: The need for atonement and sanctification through Christ
questions.explanation: The cleansing rituals and offerings in Leviticus 15 symbolize the need for atonement and sanctification that are ultimately fulfilled in Christ's sacrifice (cf. Hebrews 9:11-14, Romans 6:19-22, 1 John 1:7, and Ephesians 5:25-27).
